channel.title: World
channel.description: The Washington Post World section provides information and analysis of breaking world news stories. In addition to our world news and video, Post World News offers discussions and blogs on major international news and economic issues.

item.title: Surge in worldwide measles cases driven by lack of vaccine coverage, WHO says
item.dc:creator: Andrew Jeong
item.description: The WHO and CDC say there were about 10.3 million cases of measles last year, up 20 percent from 2022. Children are especially susceptible to complications.

item.title: Iranian student arrested in her underwear is latest symbol in fight for rights
item.dc:creator: Nilo Tabrizy
item.description: Videos of the incident show the woman arguing with police in Tehran after removing some of her clothes in protest of the country’s Islamic dress code.

item.title: Trump and the Israeli right resume their embrace
item.dc:creator: Ishaan Tharoor
item.description: Right-wing Israelis have embraced fresh Trump appointees like Mike Huckabee and Elise Stefanik, foreshadowing a closer U.S.-Israeli relationship.

item.title: As Trump’s return to U.S. presidency nears, Iran debates its options
item.dc:creator: Yeganeh Torbati
item.description: The Iranian mission to the United Nations declined to comment on a New York Times report that Trump ally Elon Musk met with Iran’s ambassador to the U.N.

item.title: IDF strikes Beirut suburbs for third day; Gaza safe zone hit
item.dc:creator: Frances Vinall, Vivian Ho, Sammy Westfall
item.description: The Israel Defense Forces issued fresh evacuation alerts for Beirut’s suburbs, warning it intends to strike Hezbollah targets around the Lebanese capital.

item.title: China opens huge port in Peru to extend its reach in Latin America
item.dc:creator: Christian Shepherd, Lyric Li
item.description: The port opening in Chancay underscores China’s growing clout in a region that once looked primarily to the United States for economic opportunity.

item.title: Tulsi Gabbard’s past comments on Russia cloud her nomination by Trump
item.dc:creator: Adam Taylor
item.description: Gabbard was named Wednesday by President-elect Donald Trump as his pick for director of national intelligence.

item.title: Argentina’s president considers exiting Paris agreement with Trump
item.dc:creator: David Feliba, Samantha Schmidt, Maxine Joselow, Chico Harlan
item.description: Right-wing President Javier Milei is considering withdrawing Argentina from the Paris climate agreement. Donald Trump has pledged to also remove the United States.

item.title: Russia pushes forward in Ukraine amid talk of negotiations
item.dc:creator: Siobhán O'Grady, Serhii Korolchuk
item.description: A buildup of Russian troops in Ukraine’s southeast comes as uncertainty looms over how a Trump presidency will affect the war.

item.title: Hospitals are running out of food as strikes continue in Gaza’s besieged north
item.dc:creator: Hazem Balousha, Hajar Harb, Heba Farouk Mahfouz , Claire Parker

item.title: Bombings in Brazil’s capital revive fears over fate of democracy
item.dc:creator: Marina Dias, Terrence McCoy
item.description: A man whom police called a political malcontent set off several explosions in Brasília on Wednesday evening.

item.title: Israeli forces hit Beirut suburbs for third consecutive day
item.dc:creator: Vivian Ho

item.title: Trump set to deepen tech Cold War with China
item.dc:creator: Eva Dou
item.description: The containment policy set in the first Trump administration and continued under President Biden will get a harder edge, former officials say.

item.title: Israel accused of war crimes and crimes against humanity by rights group
item.dc:creator: Claire Parker, Frances Vinall, Kelsey Baker

item.title: Israel prepares Lebanon cease-fire plan as ‘gift’ to Trump, officials say
item.dc:creator: Shira Rubin, Suzan Haidamous, John Hudson

item.title: Trump pick resurfaces questions about Tulsi Gabbard’s 2017 Syria visit
item.dc:creator: Bryan Pietsch
item.description: The meetings with Syrian President Bashar al-Assad hung over Gabbard, Trump’s choice for director of national intelligence, as she ran for president in 2020.

item.title: 2 patients in ambulance killed by vigilantes, police in Haiti, aid group says
item.dc:creator: Kelsey Baker
item.description: Law enforcement officers and a vigilante group attacked a Doctors Without Borders ambulance amid a broader crisis of violence plaguing Haiti.

item.title: Israel prepares Lebanon cease-fire plan as ‘gift’ to Trump, officials say
item.dc:creator: Shira Rubin, Suzan Haidamous, John Hudson
item.description: An Israeli government minister discussed the proposal with Trump and Jared Kushner at Mar-a-Lago on Sunday before traveling to the White House for talks.

item.title: Trump taps Rubio for secretary of state. What are his foreign policy views?
item.dc:creator: Leo Sands, Karen DeYoung
item.description: Donald Trump said Sen. Marco Rubio of Florida will be secretary of state. Here’s where Rubio stands on the Israel-Gaza and Russia-Ukraine wars, NATO and more.

item.title: IDF strikes Beirut’s southern suburbs; Israeli ministers welcome Trump Cabinet picks
item.dc:creator: Andrew Jeong, Vivian Ho
item.description: The Israel Defense Forces said it struck facilities used by Hezbollah for military purposes after the group fired more rockets across the Lebanese border.

item.title: Ukraine’s European allies eye once-taboo ‘land-for-peace’ negotiations
item.dc:creator: Ellen Francis
item.description: European allies are increasingly bracing for negotiations on Russia’s war in Ukraine that could include territorial concessions in return for security guarantees for Kyiv.

item.title: Trump appointees signal a new hawkish China policy
item.dc:creator: Cate Cadell, Ellen Nakashima
item.description: Trump’s potential appointees Marco Rubio, Mike Waltz and Elise Stefanik at State Department, National Security Council and United Nations signal a hawkish China policy.

item.title: Blinken helms last-minute rush of support to Ukraine before Trump takes office
item.dc:creator: Michael Birnbaum
item.description: Trump has vowed to put a quick end to Russia’s war in Ukraine, which Kyiv and some European capitals believe could force Ukraine to make painful concessions.

item.title: Blinken says Israel did not fully address U.S. concerns over Gaza
item.dc:creator: Michael Birnbaum, Rebecca Tan

item.title: Israeli forces target Beirut suburb, issue evacuation warnings
item.dc:creator: Vivian Ho

item.title: Far-right Israeli leaders welcome Trump’s latest picks for administration
item.dc:creator: Andrew Jeong
